name: scramblesthedog
text: You never know when you've taken an idea too far until you've gotten there.

name: digdugz
text: That's one reason why this strip is so good. Everyone has done this on occasion.

name: keithcozz
text: A comment left by keithcozz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Crowpaw, 7th_shot, jfenserty, TonyHighwind, odaya, bigtom, equinn2006, robbingdog, NDCaesar)

name: foetus_punch
text: A comment left by foetus_punch was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pan-Optic, thehelmet, chemuswitch, Jesus, agentstinky, Zem, sncether, scraggg)

name: spinynorman
text: Roast Beef was dead serious when he said this. It was not a Joke of Light Times.

name: lexsenthur
text: Oh so it's okay to be taken outside your moral comfort by hot sauce but the promotional material lets one toe slip outside of your preferred musical genre in an ironic fashion and it's no good GODDAMNIT RAY THIS IS A BUSINESS PLAN DO NOT MESS THIS UP

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, zcross00, littlecat, riotdejaneiro, goatmasterflash, Ananke, 7th_shot, BPMead, Ariamaki, fosters, BionicSheep, Montoya289, mania3, luckypyjamas, BrianNotBrian, aHatOfPig, logic, rj, TheGreatestCape, Epicurus, Doc_Rostov, gowerski)

name: woodenteeth
text: oh man. soticoto. totally got to me a month earlier. i really should read other replies first. apologies to all. it's not the first time i've done this.

name: soticoto
text:
Waitwut?

Did I miss something?

name: woodenteeth
text: You were making comment of people punching women in the gut, then I all had a go at foetus_punch in a similar manner just below. Too slow.

name: tasteful
text: edgy

name: woodenteeth
text:
you take things too far? really? the man who PUNCHES FOETUS'! this is not suprising.

oh. yeah. i do it as well. my username isn't nearly as telling.

name: foetus_punch
text: Shucks, you guys. Shucks. Woodenteeth, as a fellow terrible excuse for a human being, tell me what you think of this little comedic hardball I've been sitting on: post-natal abortion. It's the most PC way to say baby-killing!

name: woodenteeth
text:
Nice. Very tidy.

"After 9 months the parasite is exorcised but it quite often attaches to the exterior of the host and drains vital fluids for 18 years. Due to some kind of hormone exchange the host has illogical feelings of gratitude, it is expected this is an evolutionary mechanism the parasite has developed over thousands of years".

name: theescapist
text: I've always maintained that I support abortion up to the 72nd trimester.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Theescapist sticks to his guns.  Good show, sir.

name: kaithekender
text: what kind of adult does one who breastfeeds for 18 years grow into?

name: woodenteeth
text: Hah! Technically, you're correct. Metaphorically the "vital fluids" that are drained can be anything from basic daily energy, to monetary funds, to... well... whatever you would like.

name: kaithekender
text:
But when speaking of Scientific Things, one thinks of nomenclature and facts and the like, not of metaphor and other such non-concrete concepts

To a scientist metaphor is all CHING CHONG WING WONG

name: woodenteeth
text: Hah! Tell that to a physicist!

name: woodenteeth
text: well, it's kinda like a cross between a wave and a particle...

name: kaithekender
text: This is clearly simile and will not be tolerated!

name: woodenteeth
text: Damn.

name: kaithekender
text:
Perhaps I will, woodenteeth.

Perhaps I will.

name: stereo
text: Hey, as long as the parents are ok with it, it's just a child.  We need to stop giving children all these rights they haven't earned.  Maybe a test to prove they won't fuck around and then blame it on their upbringing.

name: tripperday
text: I was introduced to someone two nights ago, and he playfully expressed pity for me knowing the guy who introduced us. I said "As bad as he is, I'm worse." He said okay, but just stay away from his wife. I asked which girl in the bar she was, he told me, and I said "I'm gonna put in her butt first."

name: foetus_punch
text: Once, I was at a small gathering of only female friends, and I turned to one of them and said "This is how you do it: hang out with some bitches, watch Indiana Jones, and then" and here there was a sudden lull in the room as I said "fuck them all in their butts." It actually went over surprisingly well.

name: zapatos
text: We are the men who make other men less manly.

name: gmm
text: Wicked sick bastards.

name: unquotable
text: "Yesterday" by The Beatles is too far.

name: boscostacy
text: There Are Limits.

name: deusoma
text: I interpreted it as Ray not understanding that Beef was making fun of him in the fourth panel, so he increased the level of his mockery until it was obvious it was a joke.

name: philophobe
text:
Completely agreed. Look at how eager Ray is in Panel 5 when he thinks his friend is totally into his idea. Sometimes it takes a minute for the brain to catch up, and be all, "Yeah! Yeah!... Wait, this is my dogg. I know this dogg, and he ain't usually into Marketing or Enterprise."

'Cept greeting cards, of course, but hopefully we can all agree on the subversive anti-marketing sentiments of Beef's brush with celebrity.

name: lawbot
text: I think it was the consummation of the promise inherent in the original idea.

name: stephen
text: You would be able to tell that the dog was called Yard Dancer just from looking at the logo

name: gusplease
text: What a goddamn masterpiece.

name: dicecat
text: I laughed out loud consistently from panels 2-5. Brilliant.

name: sleeps
text: A comment left by sleeps was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, ishuta, jlynes, Gompo, Zem, Methadone, dj_insomniac, eRiUukFJk, Mastronaut, spicyponyhead, Appers)

name: mockereo
text: No.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: What the hell kind of name is "yard dancer"? Who names a dog a thing like that?

name: epicurus
text: I gotta say, I have not had the kind of life where "Yard Dancer" is a name I can even imagine being attached to anything but some sort of sissy lawnmower, so I had more difficulty enjoying that part of the joke.

name: agika
text: I would own that lawnmower, man.  You wouldn't catch me mowing my lawn unless I was on my Yard Dancer, all covered in sequins and with a big pink bow on the front.

name: eric
text: No

name: kelsotimebomb
text: YES.

name: apricotta
text:
Every letter of your post is worth 29.5 chubbies.

Actually, make that 30, I give you a chubby to get a nice round number.

name: apricotta
text: That is to say, this is probably the highest letter/chubby ration on assetbar.

name: apricotta
text:
*ratio

Fuck.

name: zapatos
text: Ratio Fuck.  How many people have you woken up next to, how many were attractive?  Its all about science.

name: apricotta
text:
Attractiveness is subjective, and therefore not a scientific phenomenon.
I'd formulate in in a different way: how many people have you woken up next to/how many people you actually remember getting in bed with. Indirectly, this also informs us about one's drinking habits.

name: zapatos
text: Their drinking habits, or maybe their short term memory?  I need more data...

name: apricotta
text: Short term memory, or maybe sleep disorders? I need more data...

name: zapatos
text: Let us find this data, together!  How about I buy you a drink, how about seven?

name: apricotta
text:
Twelve it is!

(Twelve drinks later... apricotta wakes up with a huge hangover)

Who are you and what are you doing in my bed?

name: zapatos
text:
Hi I'm Stuart, want to go get breakfast?

We need to do this. We need to do this for Spring Break.

name: zapatos
text:
hmm did i go too far again? maybe...

We shall find out, in the next exciting installment!

name: apricotta
text: Dude, if you're going to be so insecure with every girl you're buying drinks for, how are we supposed to gather our data? I ask you this.

name: zapatos
text:
Do not worry, I will not let it happen again. I will be best damn researcher ever!

Also, happy birthday? Your age changed overnight.

name: apricotta
text:
This will totally be a groundbreaking research, if only because what's normally an impediment (drinking and one-night stands) is an asset here.

Really? Didn't change for me, and it shouldn't for next three months.
Also, you're stalking me.

name: zapatos
text:
The greater the difficulty and stress on moral constraints, the more important the data. We are so close to a Nobel Prize, simply because of the context.

Is being stalked a problem? I can get a thesaurus, we can call it something else.

name: apricotta
text:
I think they would first have to create an appropriate category. I submit a proposition of "The Nobel Prize in awesomeness ."

I think it's less the appellation of the activity and more the activity itself that bugs me. Feels like FB all over again.

name: zapatos
text:
Whatever FB is.

The Nobel Awesome Prize

name: apricotta
text:
The Awesome Nobel Prize.

Facebook.

name: zapatos
text:
I'm on facebook. I don't really surf it for pix of hotties tho. On myspace as well, and keep my searching similar.

Mostly, I am there because I have friends and family who I can't text throughout the day. Mostly.

Also it's good for stalking girls. Oh shit. Not that one.

name: atticusonline
text:
Assetbar presents: True Love , a story of a man whose name means shoes and a woman whose name means...some sort of fruit.

Will they find true love or will all their dreams come crashing down when they reveal their most intimate secrets? Will their love break the rigid class distinctions of their time? Will love find a way? 300pp, $1200. Due November 25th

name: tekende
text: (Cornelius: Yes.)

name: dasuta
text: I can fully see Yard Dancer being a Rottweiler or a big old Great Dane. Oh god. I know people who would do this. I have RELATIVES who would do this.

name: tekende
text: Yard Dancer would be a huge pit bull. Devestatingly ugly, frothing at the mouth, but not from rabies. Anytime someone walks within 1,200 feet of Yard Dancer's large cage, he jumps about, barking like a hell demon, rattling the cage walls with his clawed feet, straining to get at the intruder. Eventually some stupid child sticks his arm in the cage and Yard Dancer tears it off with a sort of horrifying grace. Yard Dancer is put down by the county and a new law is enacted prohibiting anyone in the city from owning a pit bull.

name: aelindil
text:
Welcome to Tacoma.

You just made me sad.

name: tekende
text: That actually happened here in Oklahoma City, too, except it was a fenced yard and not a cage. It was the kid's own damn fault, but now no one can legally own a pit bull.

name: aelindil
text:
Fact: Any dog will bite if they are poorly socialized, left un-neutered, chained in a yard, and neglected.

Breed Specific Legislation is my particular soapbox subject this month! It makes me Angry, but not really the helpful, galvanizing kind.

name: tekende
text: What's awesome is that some legislator in some city who was largely responsible for a ban on pit bulls is now trying to fight the city because his own dog (a labrador) bit someone. Hilarious!

name: aelindil
text: I just read that article yesterday on SomethingAwful.  I wonder if his stance has changed at all.  Probably not, since it's not grounded in any kind of logic.

name: terribleman
text: Tearing an arm off with horrifying grace is worth at least a chubby.

name: junko
text: If you have walked past a chainlink fence in the correct naighborhood you have seen the dog named Yard Dancer.

name: cheeks_jd
text: A comment left by cheeks_jd was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by UgliestSong, farqussus, MrKennedy)

name: hellofyellin
text: Roast Beef doesn't go for fancy foods, just such as a single egg or a basic cheese quesadilla with Cholula or Tapatillo.

name: hollis
text: Yes!  The single egg!

name: hellofyellin
text: I think I might have spelled both of those hot sauces wrong.  Sauces I hold so, so dear.

name: aaronfrancis
text: You spelled Cholula correctly.

name: hellofyellin
text: Hooray!

name: philosophe
text: He would like such as a Simple Taco.

name: talix18
text: A simple Sani-Taco?

name: hellofyellin
text: No.

name: phthoggos
text: It builds on our years of experience watching Ray hatch one fly-by-night small business after another. Panel 6 is the twist.

name: catachresis
text: Ray is channeling me here. Sometimes Onstad gets too far with the sass-talk and the combined words and the Ideas and you need to say No. Ray says No.

name: waitwhat
text: A comment left by waitwhat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sakana, _cheesekayke, farqussus, erinye)

name: poodlelucy
text: rad avatar-comment conversation.

name: underpantstime
text:
when roast beef gets on a roll
ANYTHING CAN HAPPEN

name: shmuckeles
text: amen to that!

name: spicyponyhead
text: Like...a sandwich?

name: omegatron
text: I cannot decide whether to chubby this or lame it.  A pity I cannot do both.

name: slanger
text: I like Beef's way of saying "some dashes" of hot sauce... it's not quite right, but not quite wrong either.

name: centipede_damascus
text:
Yesterday,
All my troubles seemed so far away
Now it looks as though they're here to stay
Oh I believe, in Yesterday...

name: waldo913
text:
Yesterday,
We thought the elephant was here to stay
But now it's blown so very far away
Oh I believe
in yesterday

name: straw
text:
Suddenly,
That elephant's not where it used to be
Just a char mark there in front of me
O tnt
Blows suddenly

name: tekende
text:
Why it had to blow
I don't know, I wasn't told
I just lit the fuse
Now I long for yesterday

name: paperboy_2000
text:
Yesterday
I stood in a rain of red and grey
Now I need a place to hide away
I'm wanted by
the S.P.C.A.

name: apricotta
text: This is gold. You all get chubbies, every single one of you.

name: zem
text: this one is the best

name: duperando
text: This made my experience of listening to "yesterday" about 128.342 times more amazing. amazing .

name: johnnybaverage
text: I love you all so much right now.

name: anzio
text: Someone should seriously consider doing this cover. Who here can sing and play guitar?

name: tekende
text: I was reading this thread on Friday and considered recording this. With my ukelele. I forgot about it by the time I got home though.

name: dybrar
text: This is more than just an asset. This...this is art .

name: zefiel
text:
uh, wasn't Ray already in the hot sauce business, selling his Rad Chillies?

Also, beef is hardcore to eat a quesadilla with a fork.

name: terribleman
text: Ray's Rad Chilies are awesome, but they don't really take me out of my comfort zone.

name: someone3
text: i so want to see the video of the elephant detonations set to yesterday, that would be the kind of thing that makes me have the warm happy feeling inside, like internal bleeding.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Then it seems you and the elephants have some sort of special connection.

name: jackparsons
text: A comment left by jackparsons was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by farqussus, waldo913, MrKennedy, Darthemed)

name: dasilodavi
text: I kind of want to try pepper spray on my food once.  I'll bet t will be the best story of a worst idea kind of thing.

name: dumase
text:
Everyone's saying that Roast Beef just took things too far.
But i always saw it as Beef sassing him, and Ray just not realizing it until Beef takes it to the extreme. And then Ray is a little bit disappointed with Beef.

name: fosters
text: Yeah, that's my read on it too. You can tell from his first response that he isn't big on the idea of extreme hotsauce. He's just sassing Ray for taking an already bad idea and running with it.

name: fosters
text: As Ray is wont to do.

name: snowman
text:
"some dashes"

SO good.

name: baryonyx
text: Law: lain.

name: unsentletter
text: The "no" is perfect.

name: achilleselbow
text: I think Ray just said no to The Beatles because he only likes hip hop.

name: tekende
text: That reminds me of a review of Abbey Road I read on Amazon.com once. The reviewer said that the Beatles suck and that "these guys don't rap AT ALL".

name: zem
text: sounds like a pretty obvious troll, man

name: tekende
text: Yeah, probably. But it's funnier to imagine the review was sincere.

name: gigs
text: I think we have different definitions of funny.

name: mulisha7
text: I do not like condiments that take me out of my moral comfort zone. Where do people explode dynamite under elephants? That sounds kinda awesome actually.

name: 21echoes
text: reading this strip while listening to Yesterday perfects the tasteful combination of flavors of humor

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, kenthegod, bengreens, dracer2)

name: tekende
text: This post is rather uncharacteristic of pogo, I must say.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I just like that pogo tries to explain that "laughing" caused the shit in his pants.

pogo is old.

name: johnnybaverage
text: Whafuck?

name: fancypants
text: roastbeef you done hella overstepped

name: jonnyeklebs
text: "..suddenly, I'm not half the man I used to be.."

name: hendetta
text: All easter egg on the DVD constantly looping "In Heaven" from Eraserhead.

name: hendetta
text: All not being able to return to the menu and you have to turn the DVD player off.

name: tollschaft
text: I love that final frame, you can almost taste the full stop.

name: omegatron
text: If someone photoshops the front of a canister of Mouth Mace I bet they will get a lot of chubbies.

name: duperando
text: I think that is the first time Ray has straight-up rejected one of Beef's tangents

name: alilsneaky
text: This is my favorite strip so far, had me in stitches, my belly hurts from laughing.
